goal.core.program.rules

Enum RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder>
      • goal.core.program.rules.RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder>
    Enclosing class:
    RuleSet

    public static enum RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder
extends java.lang.Enum<RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder>
    The different orders in which the rules of an RuleSet can be evaluated.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ADAPTIVE
      All rules will be applied in linear order and all options generated.
      LINEAR
      Of the first rule with a viable instance, one random instance will be applied.
      LINEARADAPTIVE
      The first rule (in linear order) that is applicable will be applied and only the options of this rule are generated.
      LINEARALL
      All rules will be applied, from top to bottom.
      RANDOM
      Of all viable rule instances, one will be applied.
      RANDOMALL
      All viable rule instances will be applied, but in random order.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • LINEAR

        public static final RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder LINEAR
        Of the first rule with a viable instance, one random instance will be applied. A forall-do rule counts as one instance.

      • RANDOM

        public static final RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder RANDOM
        Of all viable rule instances, one will be applied. A forall-do rule counts as one instance.

      • LINEARALL

        public static final RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder LINEARALL
        All rules will be applied, from top to bottom. Instances from within a single rule are applied in random order. Only one instance from each if-then rule will be applied.

      • RANDOMALL

        public static final RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder RANDOMALL
        All viable rule instances will be applied, but in random order. Only one instance from each if-then rule will be applied.

      • LINEARADAPTIVE

        public static final RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder LINEARADAPTIVE
        The first rule (in linear order) that is applicable will be applied and only the options of this rule are generated. The option that is selected depends on ongoing learning.

      • ADAPTIVE

        public static final RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder ADAPTIVE
        All rules will be applied in linear order and all options generated. The option that is selected depends on ongoing learning.

    System.out.println(c);

      • isLinear

        public boolean isLinear()
        Returns:
        true iff this RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder is LINEAR or LINEAR.

      • applyAll

        public boolean applyAll()
        Returns:
        true iff this RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder is LINEARALL or RANDOMALL.

      • isAdaptive

        public boolean isAdaptive()
        Returns:
        true iff this RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder is ADAPTIVE
